page.title: 11New Hall Farm
page.content: The farmer came here in 1960. He has 151 acres: 10acres potatoes,15 acres carrots,100acres barley,the rest hay.He runs the farm with his two sons.They keep two milking cows for the house the rest are beef cattle.The farm used to have 100 sheep but these were sold last year.He does not keep hens because there are too many foxes on the Moss.The number of beef cattle varies from 45 to 100 depending on housing and money for buying them in.They are kept in barns and are fed intensively on barley,soya bean meal,fish meal,straw and hay.They are mainly Hereford or Angus cattle with dairy cow mothers.They are killed when they are a year old.They would need to be kept for 18months to 2 years if they were outside.They are sent to Chelford for slaughtering, usually on Thursdays.
